# Conduct Review Policy for Heavy Vehicle Owners and Operators

The _Conduct Review Policy for Heavy Vehicle Owners and Operators_ defines the rules governing the creation of records on heavy vehicle owners and operators (HVOOs), as well as the procedures by which their conduct is monitored and assessed.

New versions of the _Conduct Review Policy for Heavy Vehicle Owners and Operators_ and the _Conduct Review Policy for Heavy Vehicle Drivers_ came into force on **February 17, 2023**. The Excellence Program for Heavy Vehicle Drivers was also abolished on that date. Please refer to the page regarding the [revisions that have been made to the conduct review policies for heavy vehicle owners, operators and drivers](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/transportation-goods/conduct-review-policies) for more information.

page_content:
This policy stems from the _**Act respecting owners, operators and drivers of heavy vehicles**_ (Bill 430). Its goals are to:

- define the rules governing the creation of HVOO records and the procedures by which HVOO conduct is monitored and assessed
- Identify HVOOs that represent a threat to road safety and the integrity of the road network and then intervene by contacting them as quickly as possible

## Who is subject to the Policy?

All heavy vehicle owners and operators required to register in the [register of owners and operators of heavy vehicles](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/transportation-goods/register-owners-operators) of the [Commission des transports du Québec⁠ ⁠](https://www.ctq.gouv.qc.ca/english/), namely:

- owners and operators of heavy vehicles registered in Québec, whether the vehicles are operated in Québec or in another Canadian jurisdiction
- operators of heavy vehicles that are registered outside Canada but operated in Québec

Last update: May 2, 2023
